intro: Disiphon papuanus, commonly known as the Papuan disiphon, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a smooth, glossy surface. Disiphon papuanus is often found in moist, shaded habitats within lowland forests.
